title: Patriots CB Christian Gonzalez won’t make season debut vs. Steelers
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Gonzalez returned to practice this week and was initially ruled as questionable to play in Sunday's game.
Christian Gonzalez won't be putting on the pads this Sunday.
(AP Photo/Charles Krupa) By Conor Roche September 20, 2025 | 3:32 PM 2 minutes to read The Patriots will have to wait another week before their top defensive player makes their season debut.

title: Only one Apple+ game remains, Red Sox fans, then it’s wait until next year for where to watch
author: Chad Finn
bullets: Boston Red Sox The national media rights deal is changing, and different subscriptions will be required if you don’t want to miss a single Red Sox game in 2026 and beyond.
Without a variety of subscriptions, Red Sox fans will be in the dark next season when it comes time to watch the team.

Danielle Parhizkaran/Globe Staff By Chad Finn September 20, 2025 | 3:12 PM 4 minutes to read Here’s the good news: The Red Sox have just one remaining regular-season game that will be carried on a channel or streaming service other than NESN.

title: Julian Edelman sees improvement with Patriots, but isn’t sure if they’re a playoff team yet
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Edelman is also noticing strong progress with Drake Maye and the Patriots' offense.
Julian Edelman likes the direction Patriots are heading in.
(Jim Davis/Globe Staff) By Conor Roche September 20, 2025 | 2:41 PM 2 minutes to read The Patriots certainly aren’t playing at the level they played for much of Julian Edelman’s career.

title: 5 things to know about the Steelers ahead of Sunday’s game vs. Patriots
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots The Steelers' defense hasn't been too successful to start the year, which is a good sign for the Patriots.
Aaron Rodgers is entering his third game with the Steelers.
(Brad Penner/AP Images for Panini) By Conor Roche September 20, 2025 | 1:25 PM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: 11 for No. 11: Julian Edelman’s best moments as he enters Patriots Hall of Fame
author: Conor Roche
bullets: New England Patriots Edelman was a key player for the second iteration of the Patriots' dynasty years, helping him get inducted into the team's Hall of Fame on Saturday.
Julian Edelman won MVP of Super Bowl LIII.
(Jim Davis /Globe Staff) By Conor Roche September 20, 2025 | 11:41 AM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Mass. actor Chris Cooper: ‘This is the kind of thing that got me interested in film in the first place. This is what I live for.’
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Entertainment On opening weekend for “The History of Sound,” Kingston’s Chris Cooper talks about choosing roles and his path from shy ranch hand to Oscar winner.
Chris Cooper stands by the poster for his latest film, "History of Sound.
" Courtesy By Lauren Daley September 20, 2025 | 10:36 AM 9 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.

title: Healey slams proposed Eversource rate hike
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News Customers could see their home-heating gas bills increase by an average of $41 per month this winter.
More than 90,000 housing units have been completed or entered development since Gov.
Maura Healey took office, but the state still lags much of the country in housing productions.

title: Investigation underway after man dies following police encounter at Mattapan treatment center
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News The man, who has not been identified, died after a “brief struggle” with law enforcement.
A man died last week after a brief struggle with police who had been called to a Mattapan mental health facility at the request of staff.
On Sept.

title: Watch: Moose plucked from hidden well in Maine
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Local News Biologists worked for five hours to pull the 500-pound bull moose from an old, hand-dug well.
A young bull moose was rescued on Wednesday after falling into a hidden well in Pembroke, Maine.
According to Maine Public, state biologists and game wardens responded to the hand-dug stone well at Cole’s Sheds after receiving reports that a moose had become trapped.

title: Red Sox’ late comeback propels club past Rays to kick off pivotal weekend series
author: Kaley Brown
bullets: Boston Red Sox A go-ahead two-run home run by Jarren Duran in the seventh inning preceded a seven-run eighth for Boston.
The Red Sox’ bats came alive, but their pitching left much to be desired on Friday night.
AP Photo/Chris O'Meara By Kaley Brown September 20, 2025 | 7:42 AM 4 minutes to read ShareSend this article to your social connections.
